body_content.explanation: to give a new bid (= an offer to do something for a particular amount of money, when you are competing with other people to be able to do it) for something such as a job:
examples: All eligible companies were invited to rebid for the work.

body_content.explanation: to ask for new bids (= offers to do something for a particular price, when people are competing to be able to do it) for something such as a job:
examples: It is a government requirement to rebid contracts every three years.

body_content.explanation: to make a new offer of a particular amount of money for something that is for sale and compete with other people again to buy it, especially online, or at a public sale of goods or property:
examples: If you do not want the system to automatically rebid for you on any one item, leave this field blank for that item.

body_content.explanation: (in some card games) to say again, before play starts, how many points you expect to win in a particular game:
examples: What did she bid next after her partner rebid 2 clubs?
It was a difficult choice whether to re-bid or not.
